intro: Boscia foetida subsp. matabelensis, commonly known as the Matabel bush, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by both humans and animals. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
